description: Borrowed from Italian contrapposto, past participle of contrapporre.

nouns.description: contrapposto (countable and uncountable, plural contrapposto or contrapposti)

entries.meaning: (art) The position of a figure whose hips and legs are twisted away from the direction of the head and shoulders. [from 20th c.]
examples: The contrapposto flexes one buttock and relaxes the other.
